28248.name: Floating
28248.description:
Select any layer and let it float on the canvas.


You don't have to look around for information that needs to be pinned to the top when you're designing with Figma and Figjam.


Tips:

  • Drag the lower right corner of the window to resize the window.
  • Double-click the lower right corner of the window to automatically resize the window to match the content.
  • The floating window is forced to close while other plugins are running, just use the "Previous" command to quickly restore it.
  • The selected layer will be exported as an @2x image and placed in the floating window, you can drag it back into the canvas. Even more useful, you can also drag it into any chat tool or browser.

28071.name: Boiler
28071.description:
A simple Figma plugin that generates a boilerplate file structure.


Another whistle to save your time ğŸ�¶

28412.name: Width Height Swapper
28412.description: A simple plugin to switch the width and height of any kind of object, except lines.

28099.name: Quick Setup
28099.description: Quick Setup will create a few pages to get your indie project started.

28716.name: WhichUI (Work In Progress)
28716.description:
WhichUI let you vote and post your own creation to know which one is the most appropriate for your project.


You can also find informations about the project and us here: https://which-ui.com

28665.name: theme color token
28665.description:
Help you generate sys tokens for all themes, based on the token links from a full theme.

  • ref color example: [themeName]/ref/blue-50
  • sys color example: [themeName]/sys/primary


Steps to use this plugin:

  1. Create a full theme (ref & sys) in color style, make sure the folder dir matching the structure above.
  2. Create other theme's ref color palette.
  3. Choose the full theme as the basic theme, the plugin will automatically get token links.
  4. Click 'generate' to generate sys tokens based on the token links for all themes.


Tips:

  1. 'generate' will skip theme which already have sys folder, so you don't have to create empty sys folder.
28665.release_notes:
- select basic theme from theme list
- show token links in basic theme
- generate sys tokens for themes which don't have sys folder

28024.name: Page markup
28024.description: Mark the page and switch to the page

28623.name: Hexpal
28623.description:
Import HEX colors fast.

Colors are automatically added to a frame for easy organising.

28764.name: Foundation: Icon Scaler
28764.description:
Deliver Icons at a greater speed!


Foundation: Icon Scaler is a plugin to help you and your team optimize the icon creation workflow


Design one size and scale to the other desired sizes in one single click with rules defined by you.


Features

Main features:

  • Variants Names and Sizes
  • Component set generator
  • Flatten & Crop Icons
  • Import and Export Settings
  • Bulk Icon creation
  • Coming soon: Export settings


Suggestions

If you have any suggestions/features/profiles you want to be added please send me an email to:

work@jorge-fernandes.com

28755.name: FigAct
28755.description:
This is a plugin to convert Figma designs to ReactJS project.

You only need to download the project generated automatically by FigAct. Using npm install and npm run start to run ReactJS project.

Visit our website for demos and documents: https://figact.ml/

28735.name: Text Dash
28735.description:
Edit all the text layers in your selection in one place.


Intro

Text Dash will show all the text layers inside as you select any layer, and it will let you edit those text layers quickly, save you from keeping clicking layers to edit tons of text layers.


How to Use

  1. open the Text Dash
  2. select any layer (groups, frames, components, text layers, etc)
  3. edit them as you see


Contact

ğŸ“¬ Mail: tanshow@zju.edu.cn

ğŸ’¬ WeChat: badcatberry





ï»¿

28646.name: Make Checked State
28646.description:
Make a checked state for any component or variant set.


ğŸ�¶ from the creators of Make Hover State ğŸ�¶, the mad scientists at Shift Lab. Want to work with us? We're hiring!



Get Started

  1. Select one or more components and/or variant sets
  2. Run the plugin
  3. Style your new checked state variants!


This will generate a clone of the existing component (or each variant in a component set), create a variant property group called Checked with True and False values, and connect the new variant and the original with a set of click interaction triggers, creating a toggle interaction.


Limitations

There is currently a limitation with variant sets, where the plugin doesn't work if there is already a property group with the word "check" in it. This is built in so that in future the plugin can support intelligently completing half-built variant sets, but it seems like it would be very prone to edge cases so I'm not sure if I'll ever support it. For now, use the plugin on either sole components or variant sets without checked states defined.

Performs text editing on the currently selected Japanese text in the artboard.

Following the general rules of text, the following are the main checks to be performed.

  • Unification of web terms and names (Javascript â†’ JavaScript, Gitghub â†’ GitHub, etc.)
  • Mixing of "ã�§ã�™ã�¾ã�™" and "ã�§ã�‚ã‚‹" styles
  • Words without "ã‚‰"
  • Double negation
  • Continuous use of the same particle
  • Continuous use of the same conjunction
  • Continuous use of the inverse conjunctive particle "ã�Œ"
  • Mixing full-size and half-size alphabets
  • Use of weak Japanese expressions ("ã€œã�‹ã‚‚ã�—ã‚Œã�ªã�„")
  • Number of punctuation marks (no more than three per sentence)
  • Closing and opening of kanji ("ä¸‹ã�•ã�„" â†’ "ã��ã� ã�•ã�„", "å‡ºæ�¥ã‚‹" â†’ "ã�§ã��ã‚‹", etc.)
